pattern.name: Harmonic Mean
pattern.description:
We use 1.0 instead of 1 in the nominator to enforce non-integer division.
If the set contains a zero, the harmonic mean is equal zero: http://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/37628/harmonic-mean-with-zero-value However, we just ignore zeros!!!
pattern.author: Matej Polak
pattern.code: SELECT @base, COUNT(@numericalColumn)/SUM(1.0/@numericalColumn) AS @columnName FROM @propagatedTable WHERE @numericalColumn <> 0 GROUP BY @base
